channel.title: 纽约时报-全球
channel.description: 这是一个追踪纽约时报-全球news的种子

item.title: 参与这项行动的巴勒斯坦商人伊扎特-阿克勒（Izzat Aqel）说，在加沙的一次援助运送演变成一场致命灾难后数天，以色列军方协调的另一支车队未能向北部绝望的人们运送大部分援助物资。
item.description:
Days after an aid delivery in Gaza turned into a deadly disaster, another convoy coordinated by the Israeli military failed to deliver most of its aid to desperate people in the north, Izzat Aqel, a Palestinian businessman involved in the initiative, said. https://t.co/PoeXgR1qqU

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 3, 2024

item.title: 在脱离西班牙独立两个世纪后，许多哥伦比亚人仍将 "su merced"（意为 "您的仁慈"）作为日常称呼。
item.description:
Two centuries after independence from Spain, many Colombians still use “su merced,” meaning “your mercy” as an everyday address. https://t.co/2NWtt8CKzV

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 3, 2024

item.title: 从西班牙独立两个世纪后，许多哥伦比亚人在日常生活中仍将 "sumercé "作为常用的敬语。
item.description:
Dos siglos después de independizarse de España, muchos colombianos siguen utilizando “sumercé” como un honorífico usual en su vida diaria. https://t.co/ZMguZGjqGO

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 3, 2024

item.title: 海地最大的监狱遭到袭击，这是过去几天发誓要推翻总理的帮派发动的暴力浪潮中的最新一起。
item.description:
An assault on Haiti’s largest prison is the latest in a wave of violent episodes in the past few days staged by gangs who have vowed to oust the prime minister. https://t.co/CXMSQG0Wmr

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 3, 2024

item.title: 在 20 世纪 90 年代的经济动荡中，中国工业中心地带的数百万劳动者失去了工作。犯罪率和贫困率上升。双雪涛是中国最著名的青年作家之一，他的散文中充满了这种集体苦难的遗产。
item.description:
In the economic upheaval of the 1990s, millions of laborers in China’s industrial heartland lost their jobs. Crime and poverty rose. The legacy of that communal suffering animates the prose of Xuetao Shuang, one of China’s most celebrated young authors. https://t.co/9p25ZWfEeF

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 3, 2024

item.title: 近东救济工程处是巴勒斯坦人的援助机构，该机构正准备公布一份基于 100 多名被拘留者证词的调查报告，其中指控以色列军队虐待被拘留者。
item.description:
UNRWA, the aid agency for Palestinians, is preparing to publish an investigation based on testimony from more than 100 detainees that accuses Israeli troops of abuse. https://t.co/fOC6HvowOI

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 3, 2024

item.title: 去年，美国数百名儿童因肉桂味苹果酱小袋包装中含有高剂量的铅而中毒。泰晤士报》和 @examinationnews 获得的记录显示了污染是如何被忽视的。
item.description:
El año pasado, cientos de niños en EE. UU. se intoxicaron por un puré de manzana con sabor a canela en sobres con dosis altas de plomo. Los registros obtenidos por el Times y @examinationnews muestran cómo fue que la contaminación pasó desapercibida. https://t.co/Zr0OnqKwmi

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 3, 2024

item.title: 俄罗斯当局恶意中伤反对派领袖阿列克谢-纳瓦尔尼（Aleksei A. Navalny），这表明他的影响力超过了莫斯科愿意承认的程度。他死后，情况几乎没有改变。
item.description:
The Russian authorities vilified the opposition leader Aleksei A. Navalny with a viciousness that suggested he was more influential than Moscow would care to admit. Little has changed since he died. https://t.co/xjWG1Sgvp6

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 3, 2024

item.title: 周五，从南美到北美移民之路的一个关键环节重新开放，允许数百名被滞留在哥伦比亚的移民继续他们的旅程。
item.description:
A critical link in the migration path from South to North America reopened on Friday, permitting hundreds of migrants who were held up in Colombia to resume their trek. https://t.co/0L6wfm3hxQ

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 3, 2024

item.title: 在加沙以灾难收场的援助车队是当地巴勒斯坦商人在以色列官员的授意下组建的四支车队之一，以色列官员承诺提供安全保障。
item.description:
The aid convoy in Gaza that ended in disaster was one of four put together by local Palestinian businessmen at the behest of Israeli officials, who promised to provide security. https://t.co/80Ufhfk9AQ

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 3, 2024

item.title: 巴基斯坦新领导人谢赫巴兹-谢里夫（Shehbaz Sharif）的工作充满挑战。原因如下
item.description:
Pakistan’s new leader, Shehbaz Sharif, has a challenging job ahead of him. Here’s why. https://t.co/P7ZTrUNDxE

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 3, 2024

item.title: 美国官员说，让墨西哥采取更多措施遏制毒品流动的策略之一是证明芬太尼不仅仅是美国人的毒瘾--它也在杀害墨西哥人。 作者：@Nataliekitro
item.description:
One strategy for getting Mexico to do more to curb the flow, U.S. officials say, is to demonstrate that fentanyl isn’t just an American addiction — it’s killing Mexicans, too. https://t.co/MTNfTrH8TK by @Nataliekitro

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 3, 2024

item.title: 随着运往加沙的援助物资数量迅速减少，巴勒斯坦人正在努力寻找食物，人道主义者和联合国官员警告说，该飞地的饥荒迫在眉睫。
item.description:
As the number of aid deliveries into Gaza has rapidly dropped and Palestinians struggle to find food, humanitarians and United Nations officials are warning that famine is imminent in the enclave. https://t.co/pBdCwBveFA

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 3, 2024

item.title: 随着全球接种疫苗的儿童人数减少，麻疹病例开始成群出现。这种情况不仅出现在低收入国家，也出现在英国等较繁荣的国家。
item.description:
Cases of measles have begun cropping up in clusters as the number of children getting vaccinated has declined globally. It’s happening not just in lower-income nations, but also in more prosperous countries like the U.K. https://t.co/cy1v8kQRUd

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 3, 2024

item.title: 据哈马斯的一名官员 Basem Naim 称，哈马斯代表团于周日抵达开罗，参加旨在实现加沙战争停火以及用武装分子在加沙扣押的人质交换巴勒斯坦囚犯的会谈。
item.description:
A Hamas delegation arrived in Cairo on Sunday for talks aimed at achieving a cease-fire in the war in Gaza and an exchange of hostages held by militants there for Palestinian prisoners, according to an official in the group, Basem Naim. https://t.co/bqQgEbGFWG

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 3, 2024

item.title: 在柏林的一次突袭行动中，两名男子被拘留，这次突袭与长期搜捕三名恐怖组织成员有关，其中一人已于上周落网。
item.description:
Two men were in custody after a raid in Berlin in connection with the longtime search for three of the terrorist group’s members, one of whom was caught last week. https://t.co/ZV9msDZUaf

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 3, 2024

item.title: 乌克兰南部的救援人员从废墟中挖出了一对母婴的尸体，这使得最近俄罗斯袭击造成的死亡人数达到了10人。沃洛德梅尔-泽连斯基（Volodymyr Zelensky）说，盟国在提供防空系统方面的延误是造成死亡的原因之一。
item.description:
Rescue workers in southern Ukraine pulled the bodies of a mother and baby from rubble, bringing the death toll of a recent Russian attack to 10. Volodymyr Zelensky said delays by allies in supplying air defenses had contributed to the deaths. https://t.co/tkGEZ8Tci3

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 3, 2024

item.title: 在 20 世纪 90 年代的经济动荡中，中国工业中心地带的数百万劳动者失去了工作。犯罪率和贫困率上升。双雪涛是中国最著名的青年作家之一，他的散文中充满了这种集体苦难的遗产。
item.description:
In the economic upheaval of the 1990s, millions of laborers in China’s industrial heartland lost their jobs. Crime and poverty rose. The legacy of that communal suffering animates the prose of Xuetao Shuang, one of China’s most celebrated young authors. https://t.co/Fai74xSvLD

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 2, 2024

item.title: 加拿大第 18 任总理布莱恩-马尔罗尼（Brian Mulroney）去世，享年 84 岁。
item.description:
Brian Mulroney, Canada’s 18th prime minister, has died at 84. https://t.co/nHaoNJIMaJ

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 2, 2024

item.title: 挪威国王哈拉尔五世在马来西亚接受了一个临时心脏起搏器，以帮助他回家。他在一次旅行中因感染住院。
item.description:
King Harald V of Norway received a temporary pacemaker while in Malaysia to help him return home. He had been been hospitalized with an infection while on a trip. https://t.co/2nFdwzNHoz

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 2, 2024

item.title: 都柏林波希米亚人足球俱乐部将支持社会事业作为其身份的重要组成部分。批评者认为，波希米亚人已被时髦人士所取代，但他们的做法却吸引了世界各地的球迷。
item.description:
The Dublin soccer club Bohemians has made support for social causes a crucial part of its identity. Critics say the hipsters have taken over, but the approach has attracted fans around the world. https://t.co/9JRAHkP0ZR

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 2, 2024

item.title: 伊朗于周五举行了议会选举，尽管官员们在最后一刻试图通过社交媒体上的呼吁和投票站的玫瑰花来提高投票率，但许多人还是没有参加投票，以示对政府的抗议。
item.description:
Iran held parliamentary elections on Friday, but despite officials’ last-minute attempts to increase turnout with pleas on social media and roses at polling stations, many people stayed away from the ballot in an act of protest against the government. https://t.co/J5XaoonZx3

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 2, 2024

item.title: 在脱离西班牙独立两个世纪后，许多哥伦比亚人仍将 "su merced"（意为 "您的仁慈"）作为日常称呼。
item.description:
Two centuries after independence from Spain, many Colombians still use “su merced,” meaning “your mercy” as an everyday address. https://t.co/b7F4z3rtfg

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 2, 2024

item.title: 在巴基斯坦，被判亵渎罪可能意味着死刑。但暴民有时会自作主张，在案件开庭审理之前就将人处以私刑。
item.description:
A blasphemy conviction in Pakistan could mean death. But mobs sometimes take matters into their own hands, lynching people before their cases can even go to trial. https://t.co/MDx8yWnSlP

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 2, 2024

item.title: 本周世界足球通讯：英超联赛的 "腐败 "呼声；卢顿镇的时光倒流；温布利球场的紧张提醒。
item.description:
In this week’s world soccer newsletter: cries of ‘corrupt’ in the Premier League; a journey back in time at Luton Town; and a nervous reminder at Wembley. https://t.co/A6bXKfmjN0

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 2, 2024

item.title: 他的女儿问他是否见过 BTS。但这位来自孟加拉国的外来务工人员在韩国的一家纺织厂工作，每周六天，从晚上 7 点工作到早上 7 点，而这家工厂尚未支付他承诺的工资。
item.description:
His daughter asks him whether he had met BTS yet. But the migrant worker from Bangladesh works from 7 p.m. to 7 a.m., six days a week, in a textile factory in South Korea that has yet to pay him the wages it promised https://t.co/0uLFG3ULAx

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 2, 2024

item.title: 一位悼念者说，"这是我记忆中最乐观的葬礼，"他说，"人山人海，团结感油然而生。"没有悲伤。我们都在一起，我们有很多人。
item.description:
“This was the most optimistic funeral I can remember,” said a mourner, citing the large crowds and a palpable sense of unity. “There was no grief. There was this surge of inspiration that we are all together, and that there are many of us.” https://t.co/KL7MvgoupH

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 2, 2024

item.title: "一位巴勒斯坦人说："我看到了从未想过自己会看到的东西。
item.description:
“I saw things I never, ever thought I would see,” said one Palestinian who had camped out overnight for a chance to get food for his family https://t.co/34vUk1D3Jw

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 2, 2024

item.title: 针对少数球队的几次判罚并不能让英超联赛变得腐败。但这并不意味着球迷的不满没有道理。通过 @RorySmith：
item.description:
A few decisions against a handful of teams do not make the Premier League corrupt. But that doesn’t mean the fans’ grievances aren’t valid. Via @RorySmith: https://t.co/xc5Ev45zwN

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 2, 2024

item.title: 在 20 世纪 60 年代，被称为维也纳行动主义的激进艺术运动的创始人金特-布鲁斯（Günter Brus）以自己的身体和身体排泄物为媒介，震撼了这个被纳粹历史所困扰的国家，从而引起了众怒并遭到逮捕。
item.description:
Günter Brus, a founder of the radical art movement known as Viennese Actionism who courted outrage and arrest in the 1960s by using his body — and bodily effluvia — as a medium to shock a country haunted by its Nazi past, has died at 85. https://t.co/SkwdgAg7MY

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 2, 2024
